revised_title: Magnetisation Effects on the Length of Iron, Steel, and Nickel Rods
tldr: The authors investigate the changes in length of iron, steel, and nickel rods when exposed to magnetization. They find that magnetization causes iron rods to elongate, while steel and nickel rods exhibit temporary retraction and elongation, respectively. The study also highlights the influence of the metal's temper and tension on these changes.
